statement: Eurozone Dec final mfg PMI 48.8; Germany final 47.0 with export sales a key drag.
market_link: EU manufacturing contraction can pressure global risk sentiment and support UST duration; also relevant for EUR (6E) and USD (DX).

statement: NY Fed standing repo operation usage hit a record $74.6B on Dec 31 amid year-end funding needs.
market_link: Highlights calendar-driven funding tightness; focus is whether take-up normalizes post-turn for rates/liquidity tone.

statement: Eurozone M3 y/y 3.0% in Nov (Oct 2.8%); steady, slow-moving liquidity backdrop.
market_link: Secondary macro signal for EUR rates/FX; tends to matter for US futures mainly via EU risk/ECB repricing headlines.

statement: US cash close (Jan 2): MOC buy imbalance S&P +1485.3M; NQ +330.8M; Dow +432.2M; Mag7 +273.3M.
market_link: Large closing imbalances can create late-day futures dislocations and raise next-session gap sensitivity in ES/NQ.

statement: US S&P Global final mfg PMI confirmed 51.8 for Dec; in line with forecast and prior (low surprise).
market_link: More sensitivity typically in prices/new orders details than a no-revision final; incremental vs ISM narrative.

statement: UK Dec final mfg PMI 50.6 vs flash 51.2; marginal expansion but softer than first read.
market_link: UK/Europe growth tone can influence broad risk sentiment; usually modest direct impact on US index futures.
